meanings.definition: Insulting or uncomplimentary in an indirect or sarcastic way.
meanings.sent1: She gave him a backhanded compliment, saying his outfit was 'interesting'.
meanings.sent2: Her backhanded remarks made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: He tried to be funny with his backhanded jokes, but no one laughed.
meanings.sent4: The backhanded tone of her voice revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The backhanded comment left a sour taste in his mouth.

meanings.definition: Using the back of the hand to hit or strike.
meanings.sent1: He backhanded the mosquito that landed on his arm.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally backhanded her friend while gesturing enthusiastically.
meanings.sent3: The toddler backhanded the toy off the table in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The boxer expertly backhanded his opponent during the match.
meanings.sent5: The chef backhanded the dough to shape it perfectly.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent1: The backhanded sign pointed towards the exit of the building.
meanings.sent2: The backhanded view from the window showed a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The backhanded direction of the wind made sailing difficult.
meanings.sent4: The backhanded path led them away from the city.
meanings.sent5: The backhanded position of the chair blocked the doorway.
